snippet: With tensions still simmering over Chinese claims in the South China Sea, the United States finds itself trying to calm Baltic nations wary of Russia’s moves in Crimea.
abstract: Diplomatic Memo; with tensions still simmering over Chinese claims in South and East China Seas, United States finds itself trying to calm Baltic nations wary of Russia’s moves in Crimea; cases differ in obvious respects but there are also striking parallels; Russia and China are both ambitious powers, riding a tide of nationalism and nursing grievances over historical slights at the hands of the West
lead_paragraph: With tensions still simmering over Chinese claims in the South China Sea, the United States finds itself trying to calm Baltic nations wary of Russia’s moves in Crimea.

headline.main: With Russia, as With China, Unnerved U.S. Allies Seek Reassurances
headline.print_headline: With Russia, as With China, Unnerved U.S. Allies Seek Reassurances

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations
